FuncDef:
The radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id command enables an LNS or LTS to encapsulate user IDs into accounting packets to be sent to the RADIUS server.
The undo radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id command restores the default configuration.
By default, an LNS or LTS does not encapsulate user IDs into accounting packets to be sent to the RADIUS server.
CLIs: radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id accounting-request
undo radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id accounting-request
Examples: [*HUAWEI-radius-huawei] radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id accounting-request
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable an LNS or LTS to encapsulate a user ID into the NAS-Port attribute in an accounting packet to be sent to the RADIUS server, run the radius-attribute include nas-port lns with-user-id command.
